thread.title: 'Swiss Army Knife of jackets' is the most highly funded piece of clothing on Kickstarter
thread.title_full: 'Swiss Army Knife of jackets' is the most highly funded piece of clothing on Kickstarter

author: MADELINE STONE
title: 'Swiss Army Knife of jackets' is the most highly funded piece of clothing on Kickstarter
text:
'Swiss Army Knife of jackets' is the most highly funded piece of clothing on Kickstarter MADELINE STONE Last updated 09:10, September 1 2015 Kickstarter 
This travel jacket is everything you'd ever need, all at once. 
The BauBax jacket is not your typical piece of outerwear. 
Dubbed the "Swiss Army Knife of jackets," the BauBax has 15 features to simplify your life in ways you hadn't imagined. 
The jacket has everything from a built-in neck pillow and eye mask to pockets for your iPad, passport, and portable charger. Even the zipper has a purpose — it easily transforms into a pen that can extend up to four inches. 
The invention is setting records on Kickstarter , where it has raised more than US$7.25 (NZ$11.39) million from 36,600 people and counting. 
The jacket's design team, Chicago-based BauBax LLC, originally set a goal of US$20,000, but they have now raised more money than any other clothing item in the short history of Kickstarter. 
It comes in a few different styles — 100% cotton sweatshirt, water-repellent windbreaker, fleece-lined bomber, and a wrinkle-free blazer. 
Each style has several different colour options, though the hoods on the windbreaker and sweatshirt are not detachable. 
People who back the project on Kickstarter should expect to receive their jackets in November.
